Jack Higgins&#039;s previous novel, Edge of Danger, was "hugely entertaining,"
said the Los Angeles Times. "The publisher describes it as a powerful thriller,
and it&#039;s no lie." At its end, the murderous Arab-English Rashid family lies
decimatedÃƒÂ¢??but not extinct. And that may be Sean Dillon&#039;s fatal error.

After her brothers are killed one by one, Kate Rashid swears vengeance on
all who have harmed her family. Never mind that they tried to assassinate
the president of the United States, that villainy ran in their veins. They were
her brothers, and her enemies will pay.

Masterfully suspenseful, Midnight Runner is further proof that, in the words
of the Associated Press, "when it comes to thriller writers, one name stands
well above the crowdÃƒÂ¢??Jack Higgins."

READ ME!: On CD 07 there was a nasty scratch, one that ran parallel on the
surface of the disc. I wasn&#039;t able to completely fix the error, but was able to
significantly clean up the rest of the track by buffing the surface of the CD at
the damaged area. Still, be aware that starting from ~1:00:51 - 1:06:01 there will
be some noticeable skipping, some quite bad.
